data.title: Sunday Brunch and Mimosas
data.text: I love sunday brunch and I love having it here. Food is a plenty and the servers are great. I enjoy their breakfast burrito. And mimosas! It is worth the long line for a table you will not regret it.

data.title: Fond Memories Out of the Past
data.text: On a lark, we decided to have breakfast at the Granite Rock Grill for the first time. From the moment we stepped through the front door, the sights and sounds of the place reminded me of homespun restaurants of the past. We were immediately greeted by one of the cheerful staff members and escorted to a table. Our waitress, Jill, was attentive and engaged us with interesting conversation. Going beyond exceptional service, the food was quick to arrive and simply delicious. Everything was well prepared and reflected exactly what we individually ordered. Without question, the Granite Rock Grill will become a regular stopping place for us when we want exceptional service and food.

data.title: Great local spot
data.text: Our daughter took us here during our visit with her. The food was good, prices reasonable and staff very friendly!  The murals on the wall are reason enough to stop in.  What a beautiful job this local artist did!

data.title: Favorite weekend breakfast
data.text: My husband and I love this place, now we go every other weekend. The food is served with huge portions. Everything is fresh made, I would not doubt it if the eggs were being laid in the back, the biscuits, OMG let me tell you about them giant warm fist sized biscuits, yummies. The sausage gravy is something to write home about. Let's not forget the best bacon Bloody Mary I have ever tried. Every item I have tried never disappoints.

data.title: My favorite place to take my grandkids!
data.text: The portions are huge and the menu choices are extensive.  Our family loves going to Granite Rock Grill for breakfast or lunch.  The wait staff is outstanding.

data.title: Great big home style meals.
data.text: For a great value on a whale of a meal, try the Granite Rock Grill. A home style menu selection, value pricing, fast and friendly wait staff. What more could you ask for. We have a monthly breakfast for neighbors on our street. The Granite Rock is our new go-to selection. The staff gets big groups in quickly, keeps our cups topped off and puts up with our requests for separate checks.

data.title: Yum! Yum! Yum!
data.text: My wife and I discovered this wonderful restaurant on Easter weekend. The drive from Fair Oaks to Rocklin was well worth the effort. I had the breaded pork chops and eggs and my wife had the Santa Fe scramble. Our waitress explained to us the philosophy of this restaurant. It is to provide a family atmosphere with fresh homemade food and to never leave you hungry. We returned a week later just knowing the wonderful start to a Sunday. I had the pork chili verde omelet and my wife had the ham and cheese scramble. If you want to find a new place to bring into your life come to Granite Rock Grill

data.title: "Hungry Man Dinning"
data.text: Ok so me and my friends have going to this Eatery since it opened in Rocklin. The portion are grand and they always have more than a few specials for the day that is for both Breakfast and Lunch! Any dish you choose would be wonderful. Make sure you get into this Eatery before 8 AM otherwise there is wait. Thank always for the 5 Star Service and Two Thumbs Up!!!

data.title: Amazing breakfast
data.text: I tried this place out last Friday on a referral from a friend. Wow, am i glad i did. Food was delicious, portions were big, the staff was awesome, and they had grandmas old fashion biscuits like none other. Highly recommend this place.

data.title: Great homecooked meals!
data.text: We love this little gem of a restaurant! my favorite is the biscuits and gravy. they are fair priced and the service is excellent

data.title: If you leave hungry, it's your own fault
data.text: Favorite breakfast place in the area for sure.  Food is awesome and there is a ton of it.  Wait staff is friendly, fast and accurate.  They have great lunch too.  Lots of variety.  The only downfall to going to this restaurant, as with many diners is that you sometimes leave with that fried food smell on your clothes.

data.title: Great Breakfast in Rocklin
data.text: We have breakfast here several times a year (would be more often if it was closer to where we live - 30 minutes away).  There portion sizes are large enough for two seniors to share (or one large truck driver😋).  This is a typical country style restaurant with very good food.

data.title: Long lines on the weekends
data.text:
Good "ole boy" hardy western breakfast. and lunch. You
Definitely get your $$'s worth plus. Service personnel has been there (for the most part) a long time, They know their business and get to it.

data.title: liars
data.text: My parents just moved to Rocklin and I came to visit them. They live down the street from here so we walked down here. Well, on first impression it was a cozy atmosphere with a western look. The staff was friendly and we were promptly seated. The bus person came right over to take our drink order. The waitress was soon over to tell us about the daily specials which she told us was 7.99 but when we got our bill it was actually 10.99, I felt misled. With my parents breakfast she asked them if they would like toast, biscuit or muffin. My parents chose the biscuit but when the bill came we noticed there was a charge that we weren't familiar with, when we asked the waitress what it was she told us that we were charged for the biscuits, well she NEVER said that there would be an up charge for that. Again we were misled. My parents were very upset at this and told me that they  would never go back and that they would tell their friends not to go there either. This was all of our first time here and were very disappointed by being taken advantage of like this. When the bill came it was 33 bucks for what we got. My mom ordered off the senior menu and my dad got a small plate. Where they got us was the hidden charges the waitress didn't tell us about. I must say though that my pumpkin pancakes and sausage patty were delicious. What I'm upset about is the deception.

data.title: Great food at value prices.
data.text: Excellent food with a huge menu all at very reasonable prices.  Amazing service especially since the place is often packed.  Probably the best breakfast deal in Rocklin.  Even have some healthy meals.  Very friendly servers.

data.title: Something has changed and I won't ever go back
data.text: This used to be one of our favorite places to eat breakfast.  We have probably eaten her 30 times.  But it has changed.  The service is really poor.  Today I had to find someone to get coffee from, we waited almost 45 minutes for our food, and the busser gal was about as rude as it gets - really gave me her high and mighty attitude.  The owner lady who I really like - or liked - came over and said she was sorry but she really did not ask what was wrong, and never came back.  We even had to ask for the check.  Don't bother - it's expensive and the service is lousy.  It's too expensive to be treated like we were today.

data.title: Good Brunch or Lunch anytime
data.text:
Was directed to this place by a local --says this is the place for breakfast or lunch.  So happened to be in the area a couple of times in the past month and tried lunch on a Saturday and breakfast a couple of weeks later on Sunday,  Both visits were good with great service. They missed my initial request for coffee and when they checked and found out I hadn't got started --it never got down an inch before it was topped off for the rest of the visit.
Steak sandwich was a little fatty --so I would order more med-well next time.  Home made onion rings were fresh and HOT- be careful.
Breakfast special omelet --tri-tip --was loaded with onions and peppers --so if you don't like them ( or have an allergy like my partner)  leave that one in the kitchen.

data.title: Fun and full
data.text: A really fun place to go for breakfast with a large group.  While it isn't especially cheap, you will be full until dinner.  Plan to make a reservation or wait on the weekends.  Extensive menu for all, including children and vegetarians.

data.title: I used to eat here, but tired of hair in my food.....
data.text:
I used to be a regular here, but (seriously) got tired of almost every time getting
a hair in my breakfast.  Didn't matter what I ordered, it happened.  I brought it up
with the different folks, but I don't think I was taken seriously.

The other reason is that the owners seem kinda mean (husband and wife).  The
staff is nice, but it seems that the chefs slam out the food quickly, even when they are not busy.

They occassionally had potato pancakes which were excellent.  But I don't want to have
to eat and floss with their hair at the same time  ha ha

data.title: Best Breakfast Selection!
data.text: This is a place we just found 2 months ago & we've been back 2 more times.  We have not been disappointed with this establishment.  Be prepared for a wait but once you are seated the menu will blow you away.  The food is delicious and you can't complain about service.  All the wait staff help each other and your coffee mug does not remain empty for too long.  We placed our order and within 10 minutes our meals were delivered. If you are there for breakfast be sure to include the homemade cinnamon roll.  OMG! It was almost as big as the plate it was delivered on.  Enjoy!
